Dustforce truly is a work of art. I don't mean that lightly. The way it's animated plus its music gives it that title in my book. I can find myself playing one level for an hour, maybe even hours at a time. The frustration of losing levels is filled with relaxation and calmness because of the ambient music. The way the levels are crafted is truly mindblowing. They had a system in which you had to perfect a level to earn a key, and you would use that key to earn more levels. In layman's terms, to earn more levels, you had to perfect current levels. They ditched that and added an XP system in which you gain more XP to earn a key the more levels you play and perfect. I'm very glad they added this system and was skeptical about buying it. But now that I did buy it, I do not regret it even for a second. One thing I really love about this game is how you don't have to unlock base levels. In a sense, this game is open world. That sense is that many levels are available to you, and you can choose whether you want to advance into more challenging levels, or stay where you're at. To get an S in completion, you have to sweep up EVERY leaf, and to get an S in Finesse, you have to maintain your combo throughout an entire level. 

Another thing I absolutely enjoy about Dustforce is its expasive community. There are lots of Community Workshop maps for you to sharpen your skills on, and lots of people who can set a good example. I'm sure most of the people who get best times on all the levels have a Youtube channel, so you can probably catch them there. The community may or not be active, but it sure is good and friendly.

Overall, in terms of gameplay, music, artstyle, animation, and difficulty (it's not an easy game, but it's not that hard of a game either. It just depends on how much you want to play it), I rate this game:

10/10
BUY THIS GAME.

Now, ive been playing Portal since the 5th grade. And let me tell you, IT WAS HARD FOR ME BACK THEN. But, since it was decently hard, it made me want to keep playing the game, which makes Portal 2 one of the best games ive actually ever played. Portal 2 was hard. Not only was it hard, but it actually kept you wanting to play the game as well. It had such a great plot twist at the end that just made you love the game. (Im not going to reveal any spoilers, I promise.) Now, as a kid playing this game, I DESPISED problem solving back then. Portal 2 made problem solving actually fun. Not only was the game fun, but it also had a great story line, I kid you not. No matter how much Portal 2 is worth, I recommend buying it in all cases possible, I have nothing bad to say about this game AT ALL. This game is definitely worth the money in your pocket.
Wie bei Portal 1 ist die Story bei Portal 2 überragend!

Portal 2 is a great game created by Valve. You are basically a guinea pig (test subject) who is a girl named chell. And in the previous game portal the machine that created these puzzels and tricked you and tried to kill you is named GLaDOS. You eventually kill her. Well in portal 2 you are still playing as the original character chell and was in a room where you would be picked for later testing. But a robot came alon named wheatley who comes along and helps you out and you come across GLaDOS turned. but of course wheatley does something stupid and you have to fight her again going through 19 puzzles. And when you defeat her wheatley is now in charge and GLaDOS's intelligence is now in a potatoe which you carry around with you because wheatley through you two down a hole. And as you travel through the underground you come across the first testing chambers and find a story that you will have to find out for yourself. But in these testing chambers your using gel. The blue allows you to jump higher, the orange to move faster and the white allows you to create portals where it has touched. (Oh and when you get to chapter 6 you will find a achievement realating to half life. BORIALIS). And at the end you send wheatley into space and your sent out into a wheat field. I recomend this game to everyone. Now youre thinking with portals.

[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review like all my other reviews, if you want a better full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

The sequel to the highly popular Valve game, Portal 2 really improves many of the items that were either missing or were not really well done in its predecessor

Portal 2 continues the story from Portal and improves on the puzzles and gameplay, although the game has extended to 6-8 hours, it has extended the puzzles/test chambers too, there are even more test chambers in this sequel and what I complained in the first game, I will complain in the sequel, there are too many test chambers, so much so, that they get very repetitive

Although the game does send you into other parts of the Aperture Science Facilities, even throwing you into the origins of the mysterious organization, and even though the game does feature some new features to the puzzles, it still feels like the same old thing. The only bits I got really excited were when you moved away from the testing facilities and walked around some parts of the facility with some dialogue here and there

The music, where there is some music, is really nicely done, so much so, that the music also creeped me out sometimes. The voice acting is superb, both from Glados and Wheatley. A big well done to the voice actor who voiced Wheatley, I absolutely fell in love with Wheatley from the opening of the game to even the end

The secrets the game holds is really surprising! And made me want to form the story from the origin, to Portal, to Portal 2 and beyond, which is really well done and made me really happy that Portal and its sequel to relate somehow to the Half-Life franchise, which really made me excited to play Half-Life in the near future! Valve games never seek to disappoint in anyway when it comes to storytelling!

A new feature that was added into the game was Co-Op! Where you can basically play two other characters Atlas and P-body in new test chambers and with a new story and ending!

Overall, even though the sequel does rinse and repeat some of the things that bothered me in the first game, it still did not disappoint me whilst I was playing, with its great characters and its great story! It never made me stop one bit, and this was the first game for me to sit down and play almost 3-4 hours in one sitting (Usually I don't play that long in one sitting)!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]
[i] THEPCGAMER'S BEST GAME IN STEAM LIBRARY! (What's this? :- Like some games get "Best Game of 2014" or "Best Indie Game", etc... So I have decided to make my own!) [/i]
Шикарная игра

Portal 2 is a bigger-budget sequel to Portal, a mix of FPS and puzzle that makes you use Portal Gun, which was something new at time. Creating two linked portals and gaining speed. P2 was sneakily hyped up and released in 2011 on PC, PS3 and X360. Also added coop play.
It also would later had "free DLC"/update that added extra chapter to coop campaign. And then get casual-friendly level editor and challenge mode. And it also had microtransaction where you can buy cosmetic stuff for your coop robot. But no one cares about that part and it has pemanent sale nowdays.

Not sure how alive multiplayer is. It doesn't have browser of any sort, you either invite a friend or you are forced to random waiting player. I waited for 10 minutes and got none. It's 2015 by now after all. But it's a 2-player only coop, so it's better to play with friend than stranger.

The plot of main campaign is freshier than you would expect, while still remaining in same laboratories. Just ruined. With GlaDoS being resurrected. And funny eye-robot following you around, talking with British accent. And usual AAA-game storyline. With cutscenes and never ending chatter.
Yep, Valve's plot approach is no more there, it's more traditional. Which means that in this Valve game plot is more interesting in the game itself rather than in fan-made Wikia.
At least be thankful that it wasn't abusing main features of Portal 1, aka memes. Instead it tries to make it's own memes.

Otherwise eh, single-player is bigger and fancier and longer. And such stuff. Nothing radical. A bit different atmosphere, more crazy. It does bring more features in enviroment that you can interact with. WIth portals. Mostly gels. So gameplay is improved, not stagnated. It uses more of lasers and um pulling force. I kinda like how it's more merciful when it comes to laser, it just knocks you around, while you main hero feels hurt.

Though Valve lost a bit of a touch when it comes to pacing, ever since they stopped to work on Half-Life titles and moved off to competetive stuff. By the time you will get out from underground section, at 2/3 part of a game, you will feel exhausted and tired. At least I and my friend did. So not so great for beating in a single-sitting, a bit too dragged. Especially in underground section, where you actually have to search enviroments for that one batch of surface that you can place portal on.

On other hand, Coop is completely amazing. Well, at least experience with my friend was amazing, being bastards to each other while figuring puzzles for the first time, which require input from both users. It got enough of sillyness and ways to mess around while you are solving puzzles. Main part of Portal 2 for sure. But I imagine that it will be less pleasent with random griefers and trolls.

It also features rather unmemoriable music. Well, memoriable style, but not something I wanna be listening serapately. BUT it's implented in interesting way to give better atmosphere and feel during play. Like, when fast tempo music increases in volume when you are being knocked around by floor devices. One chamber even has menacing music out of three channel, which are activated when you turn on three laser grids. Great.
Oh, and graphics are your everyday pleasent Source. With style. Yes. Something. There, "mention graphic" quota done.

Oh. And it has one really nice developer commentary mode for both Single-player and Coop. Nope, not too focused on voice acting this time. Nice.

Overall, Portal 2 is quite amazing and improvement over the first one, just because it's a sequel. It lost a bit of touch, but got more exciting plot, while also intoducing new elements. It does get a bit tiresome near the end. Yet Coop is great fun with friend.

As soon as I started to get tired of the Apperture Testing I't would completely change the gameplay or story to keep me engaged. Defenetly one of the best games I have played.

Portal 2 has to be one of the most intriguing science fiction games ever to be created. As soon as I heard of it I was hooked. I've played Portal (The original) and the graphics were a bit funky, quite a few bugs, and it was also a bit hard. Portal 2 continues the rather confusing storyline of Portal and enhances it by a lot! If you've never played Portal the beginning may be a bit confusing at first. The only hard part for me was when you ended up in the old Aperture Science area. I believe the name of the Chapter was "The Fall". I've played a bit of the Co-op and it was fun to play. Just try to actually do well or GLaDoS will go crazy and start insulting you just like she did with Chell. The graphics for this game are OUTSTANDING! After a while of playing you simply cannot stop unless someone pries your fingers off your keyboard. (Don't worry, that didn't happen to me) Although, after playing all this and figuring out all the puzzles, I have quite a few questions... What does Chell do after she escapes? Does she find civilization? Can she actually talk? Is she the only human alive now? And why the heck is Aperture Science in a shack?! This gives me the suspicion that they are going to make a Portal 3. You may be asking why. My reason is because in Portal, the story ends with a party escort bot dragging you back inside, and that's all she wrote. It fills your mind with questions. Then Portal 2 came out. In the ending of Portal 2, it simply ends with Chell escaping and Wheatley wishing he never betrayed Chell. Overall, I can tell the game had a lot of effort put into it. If I had to recommend this to anyone on a scale of 1 to 10, I would say 9. Why not 10? Because some of the puzzles can be quite difficult and can make you rage. Other than that, great game! Keep it up, Valve!

When this game was released, I first played Portal 2 on the Xbox 360. Since it was astonishing, I had to get it for my PC. I just love everything about this game the puzzle solving, the characters, and the plot all hit the right notes. Co-op is fun but trust has its short coming the majority of the time.

Un gioco stupendo. Veramente bellissimo. Ci si cala nel personaggio con una semplicità straordinaria, la storia è piena di colpi di scena e ti tiene sempre interessato. Ogni livello richiede logica, più ne risolvi più ti senti soddisfatto, un gioco che tiene sempre il cervello attivo e ti fa immedesimare. Veramente  stupendo, vale tutti i soldi spesi. Nonostante sia un gioco "rompicapo" sembra di stare vivendo un'avventura in prima persona e la grafica (a mio parere) è fatta davvero bene.

Semi-spoiler (non svela nulla):
La trama è davvera piena di "cambi di gioco" e il finale è semplicemente bellissimo, geniale.

VOTO: 7.5/10
